Reviews.Title: “Good place, kind service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Cotai_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, a two bedroom apartment... It was very good for what we needed! All the facilities were clean and maintained (with exception of our A/C, which was a bit noisy...) Very good location... not in Central, but close to 2 MRT stations and if you like to walk, close enough to the Center. The only down was breakfast and the construction site right next to the hotel... (noise stops at 10 in the evening, and you hardly note, but the street is closed, which makes it hard for taxis...).

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: mnrose1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights here while visiting Singapore. We are a family of 4, including 2 older children (12 year olds). We wanted to all stay in 1 place and we quickly discovered that only a few hotels offered rooms which would accommodate our family. Fortunately, we got this place at the last minute on booking.com for a fair price, especially given that it was a spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom place. It was clean and quiet, although there is construction on the street side which would have been loud during the day had our room been on that side. Ask for a room in the back of the building. The room was well equipped, although I wish it had a washer/dryer. They do have communal washers and it cost $4 to wash and the same to dry. The breakfast was excellent and offered variety for nearly everyone. No complaints there. Plus there is a food court across the street. We ate a couple.of meals there which were inexpensive in an otherwise expensive city. Finally it is a convenient location with several MRT stops within walking distance. If we ever visit Singapore again, I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: EllyN_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a month in a one bedroom apartment. The space is small, and I didn't get that cozy feeling throughout my stay. In general, the place is well-equipped, the kitchen has enough utensils for basic cooking, the gym is decent, and the breakfast was basic. But you will get sick of it after awhile. The rooftop pool is quite nice as there were not many people utilizing it. A few comments about my stay: 1. Housekeeping - I wish the staff is more courteous, as there had been a couple of times while I was getting ready for work, the staff pressed the bell and said "housekeeping" and before I could even respond (less than 3 seconds), she already made attempt to open my door (the latch was closed, luckily). That saved me from embarrassment as I was not entirely decent at that time. Also, there was a time when they did not change the linen for 5 consecutive days (but to be fair I did not request for housekeeping on 2 days in between). And also they forgot to leave any towels after they took away the dirty towels, and I had to request for it. There is also one time when the aircond remote was hidden under the linen after they made the bed! I had to look around for it for awhile! 2. The oven in the kitchen was not working, I made my complaint, and they said they fixed it, but it was still not working when I tried to use it. 3. This is not really the place's fault, but the construction can be bothersome due to the noise and accessibility. Besides the comments above, I would say that the location is actually good to get around, there are 2 MRT station and one of them is Dhoby Ghout which is the main station with many lines which is about 10min walk, and Bras Basah station about 5mins walk. Plenty of bus stations around as well and getting taxi at the area is fairly easy. Food-wise, there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Especially if you are a muslim traveller, in the same building there is a halal nasi padang restaurant, which is quite famous among Malays in Singapore, 24-hour Indian restaurant just a block away and a halal chinese restaurant behind the block. There is also a mosque within the building. I think if they put more effort to improve on the services with a bit of refurb to the room, this place has potential especially once the mega-construction across the place is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Only basics”
Reviews.Author: tuu32
Reviews.Content: I had a one bedroom apartment. The size is fine for one or a couple but the decor was like it was from late 90s. There is a small two seater rock hard sofa and a coffee table in the living room and a two seater dining table. The kithhen had couple pans and well stocked with glasses and plates. The bed was rock hard and I bought my own pillow. The pool was nice but overall this has a 3+ feeling. I was happy to check out after a month. I woudl rather stay at Citadines Mount Sophia than here next time which is similar price but more up to date and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment with everything you need, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: boblix
Reviews.Content: Somerset apartment equips everything for family stay. It is close to two subway stations (10 mins walk). Breakfast could not be simpler, only bread and cereal. Opposite the street there is a main construction site, which starts making noise from 9am to 7pm. Pool is at roof floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; Rooftop Pool and Playground”
Reviews.Author: h4ni
Reviews.Content: The first thing that struck me about this place is that it is a little tired. I agree with the previous reviewers that it certainly is not luxurious but it was clean and had everything we needed. We wanted more space than just two hotel rooms for 2 adults and 2 kids, and a small apartment was what we were looking for. In that sense it was perfect. What I didn't like was that the apartment seemed a bit dark and that the bathrooms are not well-ventilated and smelled a bit damp, especially after the doors were closed all night. The one thing that did bug me was that the balcony light can't be turned off and the curtains don't close all the way in the master bedroom. Basic crockery is provided, and tea and coffee. Fruits, drinks and snacks can be bought from the 7-eleven across the street. The rooftop pool is great not only for the kids. There is a playground on the rooftop as well, though I would have used something more solid than glass for the barrier (quite scary for people afraid of heights). Breakfast was provided in our rate and was of acceptable quality and with sufficient choice. Again, if you are not expecting luxury then you won't be disappointed. There is construction going on in the road in front of the hotel but this is only during the day so it didn't bother us. Location-wise, it is excellent. Convenience stores and fast-food outlets (including Subway and Coffee Bean) are near by. Two MRT stations are within walking distance: Bras Basah station (2 minutes' walk) and Dhoby Ghaut a bit further up. The purple line from Dhoby Ghaut takes one to Harbourfront (Sentosa) in no time. Bras Basah is on the Circle Line which takes one to Clarke Quay. Also within walking distance is the National Museum, which is really worth a visit, especially on a rainy day. Muslim travellers may find it convenient that there is a mosque is located on the same block.

Reviews.Title: “somerset bencoolen”
Reviews.Author: HirenMotla
Reviews.Content: We Chose To Stay At Somerset Bencoolen When I Visited Singapore And The Stay Was Good And Safe Place The Mrt Station Was Near Aprox 12 Min Walking And Indian Food Was Also Not A Problem As Little India Was Around 3 Bus Stops Away The Hotels Location Is Good The Rooms Are Clean And Its Tarrif For A Long Stay Is Reasonable. Its A Kind Of A Service Apartment Where There Is No Room Service For Food Provided In The Room But They Have Given A Kitchen With The Basic Things To Work With Which Makes It Eassy For The Person To Prepare His Or Her Own Food Without Any Problem Other Food Items Can Be Purchased From The 7/11 Opp The Hotel. Breakfast Is Provided By The Hotel. For A Long Stay With A Reasonable Tarrif This Could Be One Of Ther Best Hotels In Singapore As The Location Is Good Its Safe And The Rooms Are Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday September 2011”
Reviews.Author: alpatdunc
Reviews.Content: We chose Singapore as our family holiday this year after a stopover to Europe last year. We were intrigued with what Singapore could offer as a family holiday. We did our research before leaving as we always do and it paid off. We had a list long enough to cover our 10 days stay and more. We chose to stay at the Somerset Bencoolen serviced apartments due to having 3 loud boys and also it was more practical than getting two hotel rooms and cheaper. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite and had an extra bed set up in the lounge area. It was well furnished and the beds were comfortable even the rollout. The bathrooms were substantial and all the little shampoos and niceties were supplied as well and even replaced. It had a well equipped kitchen with all the utensils required to cook and eat. A good sized fridge and microwave. The minimum stay I believe is 7 days so that needs to be taken into consideration before booking. The rooms were cleaned every day and the staff were very polite and helpful. The breakfast was a wonderful buffet breakfast so there was no need for us to go out for breakfast at all and the kids loved it which is saying something! Singapore is such a beautiful place. There is the shopping; the people; the zoo; Jurong Birdpark; Chinatown; Little India; Science and Technology museum; Snow City; Marina Bay; Singapore Flyer; 737 simulator; beautiful exquisite buildings to admire; Clark Quay; Boat Quay and of course Santosa Island with Universal Studios and various other attractions including the chairlift and luge it just goes on. We ran out of time to do everything and they are still building new things. There is an ice rink in the new section of Marina Bay with beautiful boutiques. We were 10 mins from the nearest railway station which is easy to use and you get a $SG1 refund on each ticket after use so it only costs $SG1 per trip or thereabouts. We loved it and our kids had the best time. Also the Somerset Bencoolen has a great rooftop area with lap pool spa and toddlers pool and playground.

Reviews.Title: “Constant constuction in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Wilp33
Reviews.Content: After a week at the Bencoolen my head is really hurting! There is so much contruction going on. Between 10am and 10pm it is virtually impossible to be in your room - they are building a train station right out the front and digging up the road directly out the back - this looks like continuing for a few more months. The Great - the pool was awesome, always plenty of towels and places to sit, and the view up on the roof pool was lovely. The house keeping staff were lovely and really helpful, And kept the rooms really clean, and the location really cant be beaten The not so great - the free wi- fi connection was hit and miss, and the helpfulness of reception in addressing this was hit and miss - some staff were great others had no interest in helping you. The ugly - the contruction noise! nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient location but very dated”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeRedDot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one month after being relocated to Singapore. I hadn't a clue where this was and on a map, it looked like it was in a bit of a no-man's land between Orchard Rd and the marina front. How wrong I was. It simply couldn't have been a better located hotel. Within walking distance are 2 of Singapore's most interesting districts - Little India and Kampong Glam. Both worth a 10 min walk to sample some authentic Singaporean experiences - shops, markets, food, architecture. The hotel is also right in the middle of what Singapore is trying to brand as the 'Arts District' - so there are galleries, musuems and exhibitions all around you. Orchard Road for major shopping is about 10-15 mins away. Fort Canning Park is one of the nicest green spaces in Singapore and that is about 5 mins walk from the hotel. We found ourselves doing a lot of exploring on foot to get to know our new home city and found you could reach any of the touristy spots within a 30 min slow wander. Transport wise - 2 mins to Bras Basah MRT station on the Circle line. Not very useful to be honest but less than 10 mins away is Dhoby Ghaut which is one of, if not THE, main MRT interchange. You can access 3 of the 4 lines from here and go anywhere you want to. There is also a heap of buses on the corner of Bras Basah Road which will get you to the Financial District/Marina Front in about 10 mins. There's also a taxi rank right out the door so that comes in handy for getting around too. It's also right opposite a great, cheap, clean food centre - part of a well known chain called Kopitiam. If you are going to go there regularly then buy a card which you load up with cash and you will get 10% discount when you pay with that rather than cash. You will also find some of the cheapest beer in Singapore here too - large bottle of Tiger for SGD$5 vs small bottle of Tiger in a bar for SGD$12. If you are self-catering, then it's opposite a 7-Eleven for emergencies or there is a Cold Storage Supermarket in a place called POMO on the road that runs behind Bencoolen Street called Prinsep. There's also cafes, bars and some food places along this road too. Drinking wise - you can walk to a place called 'Chijmes' (big bar/restaurant complex) by walking along Bras Basah Road for about 10mins. There's lots of choice around you. The hotel itself is extremely dated - our 1 bedroom deluxe room was just about OK in size for 2 people but it was so dark and '80s' we found we had to escape the room as much as possible. Thank god for the great location! Hard to self cater too with just one frying pan and enormous stock pot. Plus our room had an adjoining door with next door and the cooking smells from their room would drift over to ours and linger for days. It really wasn't pleasant. Ended up buying tonnes of air fresheners. However, the hotel provided some great cable TV channels and free, reliable wi-fi so big thumbs up for that. The rooftop pool is simply stunning though with great views - especially over to the financial district. There is also a jacuzzi on the roof too but in the month we were there is only worked once. There is also a semi-decent gym and a cheap and fast laundry room. Other positives were the staff - very friendly and polite. Room was cleaned spotlessly everyday. Very unobtrusive service. Overall, it was a great introduction to living in Singapore. Shame about the hideous rooms. It really needs some renovating and then it will be an amazing place. Would recommend it still though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Somerset apartments on a business visit (1-bed apartment) - Bedroom: compact for 1 person but could be claustrophic if 2 people aer staying. Has a small stand-in closet with a mini-safe. Enough space for clothes. Suitcases/bags have to perched on the top shelf. - Kitchen: Has electric cooker/oven, microwave, Limited cutlery, big pots (only 2), no small knife, no proper strainer - Building works next to the apartments - 7 days a week, sometimes until midnight. Drilling, grinding and hammering noises start from 9am Mon-Sat. Expected to continue until Dec 2011 - Hardly any TV channels: have to subscribe to channels (fairly cheap though) - Toiletries (body lotion, shampoo, conditioner) only provided once on arrival - Entertainment: TV, VCD/DVD player, satellite (subscription), CD / Tape player (no ipod connection) - Helpful staff who ensure your stay is comfortable. Also can do some of your basic grocery shopping for you (the odd one can also show you attitude for doing the shopping for you) - Cold Storage supermarket (part of the PoMo shopping mall) is a good place to shop with a good variety to offer. - Little India is only 10-15mins walk away (via Selengie street). Can get good tops, sandals, kitchen items & other goodies in the Tekka Market which is at the beginning of the Serangoon Road. - Money Changer: outside on street level. Opens around 10am. No ID or passport required. But there are many money changers around towards Bugis (turn left from the building and carry on to the traffic lights) - ATM machine: near traffic light junction on the left (in the food court area) - going towards Bugis area. - Bugis area: has many shops / stalls for clothes, beauty, handbags, etc, especially on Sundays. - Orchard Road: 10-15 mins walk away or 1 MRT stop away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice home at singapore”
Reviews.Author: nice_cities
Reviews.Content: Somerset Bencoolen has new minimalist interior. We ( 2 adults, 2 children - 4 & 8 years) spent 3 nights in 2 bedroom apartment. The rooms are very clean. The bed are quite conform for our back. Our children had try the swimming pools and mini children playground. The breakfast was very limited choices of asian foods. We only had breakfast at 1st morning. The next mornings we had breakfast at mini foodcourt accross the hotel around S$ 5 per person. The best thing of Somerset Bencoolen is the location. It is not to croweded like Orchard area and not far from Orchard road. About 500-600 m walk to dhoby ghout MRT station. There are some restaurant at dhoby ghout MRT station. We also walk to Bugis street (500-600 m) to get some souvenirs. Most of souvenirs around S$10. It is much cheaper than other places in singapore for souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: Liling
Reviews.Content: The 2 rooms apartment is spacious with open kitchen and cutlery. But the breakfast is less of choices not even have local food choices with something hot to eat eg, Singapore's fried mihoon or fried rice. Only serve breads.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSkiers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with our daughter and grandaughter who is almost one year old in a two-bedroomed apartment. The master bedroom has a 6' bed, fitted wardrobes which include a safe and a bath in the ensuite. The second bedroom has a 5' bed, fitted wardrobes and a desk area. There is a separate shower room. The combined living/kitchen area contains a full-size 'fridge, microwave, kettle and toaster. Bottled water, tea and coffee are provided and replenished daily. Bed linens and towels are white and good quality. The cleanliness of the apartment was excellent. A cot was provided which was sturdy, clean and provided with decent bedding. Soft furnishings are beginning to look tired, ie, a couple of stains on sofa cushions and black mould is starting to form in the shower enclosure. The complimentary breakfast is sufficient for most people's needs. The rooftop swimming pool is a terrific bonus in steamy Singapore. A big plus to this accommodation is the staff who are first-class and for whom nothing is too much trouble; we were greeted like family each day we returned. The hotel is in a very convenient spot, a short walk from everywhere one would like to visit, ie, Little India, Chinatown. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smash4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The staff were very friendly and gave us really good service. They even gave me a cake on my birthday!! The location was great; it was just down from Orchid Road and close to a supermarket. There were food places in walking distances and a taxi stop right out the front. We arrived very early and they let us check in straight away.The facilites were good- it had everything we needed. The pool and gym were fine; nothing extravagant but it was just what we needed. The breakfast was ok- basic but enough.I would definately stay here again and recommend here for anyone who wants a self contained apartment with great faciltiies!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more - great apartment, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsandme
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is an apartment, not a hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for one week. We were made to feel welcome and valued from the time we stepped in the door. We arrived early in the morning and they got our apartment ready as early as they could for us, even gave us breakfast while we waited. The apartment was clean and spacious, had nice balcony with table and chairs on it and access from both the main bedroom and the lounge area. Kitchen was quite big with large fridge, oven, microwave, and all crockery, glasses, cutlery, a casserole dish, pots, pans and it even had a fire extinguisher. Open plan dining/lounge area with table and 4 chairs. sofa and lounge chair in it. Plenty of cupboard space in the apartment to stow away your suitcases. Good security - you need your door card to go anywhere in the building via lift. Pool is clean and refreshing with towels supplied, a large jacuzzi and there's a paddle pool for the kids. There's also a playground for the kids and a self serve laundromat which was extremely clean and they have sewing kit available if needed. There's a gym and a library which we didn't use. Daily housekeeping (except Sundays), a buffet breakfast room if you prefer to have it supplied with roughly the same thing every day - which was nice and fresh and restocked promptly, very clean. You could eat either inside or out in the courtyard which was lovely with plenty of shade. They have thought of everything - a torch in case of power failure, iron, ironing board in room, laundry basket, bathroom scales, they even supply toiletries and tea and coffee sachets to get your stay started until you can get to the supermarket. Position is ideal - easy walk to Bugis St and Arab St, we even walked to Orchard Rd and the Merlion with ease and we are all in our late 40s and up. Taxi rank just outside the front door, plenty of hawkers stalls in the area for food if you prefer not to cook, 5 minute casual walk to Douby Gaut rail, buses about a 2 minute walk from the door. They have secure car parking also. Staff were wonderful, informative and very friendly, they even arranged a van to the airport for us at our request due to all our luggage which was punctual and they even loaned us a power conversion adapter. Internet was fast and always available too. Main bedroom had plenty of room each side of bed but the door almost touched the foot of the bed, it had plenty of wardrobe space with drawers in one side and shelves and a safe in the other, an ensuite which was a decent size and had plenty of cupboard and shelf space, a large mirror, good lighting, and a long bath with shower over tub; 2nd bedroom was spacious all round with good wardrobe space - didn't look inside so not sure if drawers in it too, it also had a desk and floor to ceiling windows. Bathroom had shower, toilet and washbasin, good mirror and shelves and cupboards. What more can l say - would definately stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and practical for a 7 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma_Dxb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment, with an extra bed in the lounge for our eight year old daughter. The TV spun round to be viewed either in the lounge or bedroom which allowed us to stay up to watch a film even after she had gone to bed. There is a taxi rank outside, and the Dhoby Ghat MRT station is walking distance (10-12 mins) from the property. The 7-11 is across the street and is convenient although has little choice. In the road behind the hotel there is a shopping centre that has a larger supermarket on the basement floor, or there is a Carrefour at the mall adjacent to the Dhoby Ghat MRT station. This information wasn't plainly obvious by the hotel, but we should have asked earlier. The breakfast wasn't very good and the service was a little officious. We tried it once then preferred to eat in our apartment. Swimming pool was quiet (when we were there) and a little cold (but OK if you keep moving about). Long and thin, so decent enough to do lengths. Gym was pretty sparse. Many restaurants for all budgets in the surrounding areas. Chijmes (with multi restaurant offers) within walking distance as is the Raffles Hotel. Orchard Road (for shopping) moreorless starts at the MRT station so is also easily accessible. It is OK to drink tap water in Singapore - only worked that out towards the end of the stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Somerset Bencoolen!”
Reviews.Author: Wynns
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks for a family holiday with my 14 year old son and mother-in-law. The 2 bedroom apartment gave us the extra space we needed. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was OK - but the hot food was usually cold. Other than that, everything was great - rooftop top was beautiful! The location is also briliant - walk to Orchard Road and many other attractions. Great food choice close by and a taxi rank at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: melaniec08
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our first overseas family holiday, with our 1yo and 3yo. The Somerset Bencoolen was fantastic. We had a 2 BR apartment which met our needs perfectly. The staff at reception were friendly and helpful, and within a few days knew all of our names. The apt was great, each bedroom and the living area had a separate split system air con unit, which we could control. The pool area was also great - in addition to the lap pool there was a wading pool (at the end of the lap pool), a separate toddler pool and a spa. The playground was small, but had good equipment and was shaded in the afternoon. Breakfast was served in a dining room with a terrace leading from it, so we could sit down and eat and let the boys run around without them bugging other people trying to eat. The only glitch with the place was that at peak times the hot water in our shower was lacking. Apart from that I couldn't fault it. Great location too - a few supermarkets nearby, great food court just down the road (which also did takeaway), and could walk to most places we wanted to go. Overall, a great place to stay, esp with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for families”
Reviews.Author: leez6666
Reviews.Content: When we were searching for a place to stay in Singapore we were keen to find apartment-style accomodation as opposed to a hotel. We have a 4 year old son and wanted him to have his own space and have the ability to put him to sleep and not have to go to sleep at the same time! We found this and much more at Somerset Bencoolen. The apartment (we stayed in a 2 bedroom one) was fantastic - modern, 2 bathrooms, great kitchen & lounge. Breakfast was provided every day in the dining room on the 5th floor. The pool area (on the roof) was fantastic with amazing views and a separate pool, spa and children's paddling pool and playground. Our 4 year old wanted to be in the pool almost every minute of the day! The staff were all exceedingly friendly and provided excellent service. The aprtments were close to transport and taxis were always coming past (max of about AU$5.00 to go most places). We walked to most places (even with a 4 year old in tow) so as you can tell it wasn't far from anything. My husband loved it due to its proximity to all the fishing stores in the Bugis area! Suffice to say we loved it and will certainly stay there again when we return to Singapore.

HotelInfo.Name: Somerset Bencoolen
HotelInfo.Address: No. 51 Bencoolen Street, Singapore 189630, Singapore
